Message.Title: Romney Only Tweak Obama Care NOW
Message.Msg: I feel companies knowing this alone, would be a good beginning. This plus some tax loop hole closings would get the economy going. Just, knowing a version of Obama Care will be their should really help companies, including AT&T, and it's customers. The rest wil be good old Capitalism, their are companies with plans to start, grow, develop. Best get it done before the other guy does.
Ask the bounce he gave Obama. What other off base opionions do you have?

Topic.Title: Obama today again admits his desire to raise taxes

Message.Msg: "be specific about what you would cut to balance the budget" EPA, NPR, NEA to begin with Oh, G-O-O-O-O-O-D answer!!!!! EPA? Good idea. Let’s just turn the environment over to you corporate denizens of the world who have done such a terrific job self-regulating the planet into a cesspool for quick profit. No big deal. Global warming is a socialist conspiracy, anyhow. NPR? Well, the Federal, State and local government funding of NPR’s budget is less than 5%. Of course when all you watch is FOX news and Real Housewives with Toddlers & Tiaras from the Jersey Shore home of Jerry Springer & the Kardashians, you, no doubt won’t miss NPR. The N.E.A.? Another splendid idea. In order to miss the NEA, one would have had to had some encounter with some rudimentary elements of education at some point in his life. Obviously, that isn’t you – but let’s privatize education so only the rich learn anything, and keep the working class ignorant so they’ll believe nonsense from fools like you.

Topic.Title: Obama today again admits his desire to raise taxes

Message.Msg: How come I never get granted anything?

Topic.Title: Obama today again admits his desire to raise taxes

Message.Msg: Yes, let’s raise taxes by cutting out many of the corporate tax loopholes, the loopholes that keep Congressional campaign contributors contributing. Let's raise some taxes, but let’s also get serious about spending reductions and finally, finally, get serious about the waste and fraud in our government spending. Raising taxes so the Democrats can give more away to their favorite voting blocs is not the answer and Sorry Lord Barry, but Harry is wrong, compromise is not doing what you want and getting everyone else to kowtow to your wishes. It means working out deals that will actually accomplish something good for this country and our finances. Creating new commissions, new departments, new Czar positions, ignoring government waste and not just flat out firing the cheaters and the wanna be kings is wrong and always should be. We have to stop the government sponsoring of unions and their corrupt leaders, let the unions survive or fail based on their own activities and value.

Topic.Title: Obama today again admits his desire to raise taxes

Message.Msg: Yes "And if we go back to the tax rates for folks making more than $250,000 a year, back to the rates that we had under Bill Clinton," he continued, "we can close the deficit, stabilize the economy, keep taxes on middle class families low, provide the certainty that I think all of us would be looking for."

Topic.Title: DNC delegate threatens to kill Romney

Message.Msg: Obama supporters are out of control also threatening republican Rep. Trey Gowdy with a gun. A 52-year-old Atlanta woman was charged on Sunday with pointing a gun at U.S. Rep. Trey Gowdy while he sat in his car. Gowdy was waiting in his car when a woman “pointed the weapon at him with a threatening gesture said Spartanburg Public Safety Director A. Tony Fisher. Fisher said Spartanburg officials are working with the FBI and others federal authorities about possible federal charges. Gowdy was not injured, Fisher said. As Gowdy drove away, the suspect sprinted across the parking lot, but did not catch up to him, Fisher said. Gowdy then drove to the police station to report the matter. Police “conducted an intense search” to find the woman, Fisher said. She surrendered without incident.

Topic.Title: Obama today again admits his desire to raise taxes

Message.Msg: Gee, Winjon, It would appear that you’re so out of ammo that you’ve taken to posting Republican talking points that are over two and a half years old. I’d post the link, but, well, you know...board improvements. Those points have been on numerous right-wing websites, but originated with GOP.gov on February 25th, 2010. (“Courtesy of the Senate Republican Policy Committee.”) They didn’t help you back then, and regurgitating them now won’t either. Affordable Health Care has come to America and it’s not going away. Frankly, the rest of the civilized world has viewed the fact that the richest country on the planet could outspend the next 17 countries combined on defense and wars, but couldn’t provide universal affordable health care to its citizens, as greedishly archaic. You can keep pimpin’ for the Insurance industry, but the American public is no longer buying your act.

Check out the 50 or so appointments he's made from Goldman-Sachs into government offices handling public money. A very unfunny joke.
